definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: Punctuation marks are an integrant sign of cohesion and coherence in modern writing.
sentences.chinese: 標點符號是現代書面語中不可缺少的銜接和連貫標誌。

sentences.english: English for science and technology treatises belongs into written language and has its own style.
sentences.chinese: 英語科技論文屬書面語體，其文體已自成一格。

sentences.english: Bai people speak Bai language in everyday life but use Han language(Chinese) as a written form.
sentences.chinese: 白族在日常生活中說白語，但使用漢語作爲書面語言。

sentences.english: Deaf children, mostly into learning sign language and writing deaf-mute began to grasp.
sentences.chinese: 聾啞兒童大都入了學，聾啞人開始掌握手語和書面語。

sentences.english: There is no doubt that these two words are spreading in at any rate written usage.
sentences.chinese: 毫無疑問這兩個詞在書面語中用得越來越多。

sentences.english: Of all language families, Semitic languages have the longest written lifespan.
sentences.chinese: 在所有的語言家族中，閃語的書面語歷史最長。

sentences.english: It is made up of spoken Chinese and written Chinese.
sentences.chinese: “語文”是漢語口頭語言與書面語言的合稱。

sentences.english: The writing false speech act should be study.
sentences.chinese: 書面語體的虛假言語行爲研究。

sentences.english: The model assumes that written discourse is also an interactiver proccess.
sentences.chinese: 該模式認爲書面語也是一種交往過程。

sentences.english: It's easy to see how the emergence of written languages represented a boon.
sentences.chinese: 顯而易見，書面語言的出現代表着一種進步。

sentences.english: Written language requires a firm understanding of sequencing and subordination.
sentences.chinese: 書面語言需要有對順序和從屬的認識。

sentences.english: Nominalization is a distinctive feature of written English.
sentences.chinese: 名詞化是英語書面語的一個顯著特徵。

sentences.english: The invention of printing also meant that there was now a common language in print.
sentences.chinese: 印刷術的發明使得書面語流行起來。

sentences.english: Nominalization is one of major differences between written English and spoken English.
sentences.chinese: 名詞化是英語書面語的一個重要特徵。

sentences.english: What is more, the written language is the repository of the finest literary achievements of a society.
sentences.chinese: 愈甚的是，書面語是庫中最良好的文學成績的社會。

sentences.english: Several Sami languages are spoken and written in the northern regions by the Sami people.
sentences.chinese: 在北方薩米人有幾種薩米語作爲口語和書面語。

definition: Jyutping, one of the many Cantonese romanization systems/abbr. of 粵語拼音|粤语拼音[Yue4 yu3 Pin1 yin1]
part of speech (noun, verb, adjective etc)/lexical category
(phonology) coda, the part of a syllable that follows its vocalic nucleus (e.g. "u" in kòu or "n" in běn)
